message.content:
cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.NI 

The paper presents a neural algorithm implemented on a neuromorphic system for the rapid online learning and identification of odorant samples under noise, based on the architecture of the mammalian olfactory bulb. This work involves the use of neural networks and machine learning techniques, which are commonly associated with the arXiv CS sub-categories of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of spike timing-dependent plasticity rules, which are a form of unsupervised learning, and neuromodulation and contextual priming, which are forms of reinforcement learning. These topics are also relevant to the arXiv CS sub-categories of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.SY (Systems and Control). Finally, the paper mentions the use of adult neurogenesis to enable lifelong learning capabilities, which is a topic related to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.NI (Neuroscience and Neuroinformatics).
